intro: Diplocaulobium elongaticolle, commonly known as the long-colled diplocaulobium, is a rare and specialized moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender leaves that are often recurved and have a distinct, glossy appearance. The plant forms dense, cushion-like growths on acidic, shaded soils, typically in moist, temperate forest environments. Its reproductive structures, including the elongated capsules, are positioned at the tips of the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
